label: Behavior 70822580
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 54.3662 + 0.0001 × t - 0.00005 × t², lon(t) ≈ 10.1405 + 0.0042 × t + 0.0003 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a consistent speed with gradual increase from 1.2 to 7.3 knots, indicating steady propulsion without abrupt changes)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG evolves slowly from ~114° to ~93.5°, then shifts more significantly to ~53.6°, indicating a planned, smooth trajectory adjustment over time)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains close to 102° for most of the segment, with only minor deviations, suggesting controlled steering)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 54.3662 + 0.0001 × t - 0.00005 × t², lon(t) ≈ 10.1405 + 0.0042 × t + 0.0003 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
